intro: Psoralea triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikes, which are often clustered at the ends of the stems. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Psoralea triflora is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
